properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Bledisloe Cup Test: Wallabies v All Blacks at Accor Stadium in Sydney Olympic Park on Saturday 21 September. Gates open at 2pm. Kick-off from 3.45pm and full time around 5.30pm.

With multiple events taking place in the precinct, a combined crowd of up to 100,000 expected in Sydney Olympic Park across the day. Significant delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: parking in the precinct is in high demand and expected to sell out before the event. Ticketholders who have to drive must pre-book parking ahead of time to secure a space.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
The Henty Machinery Field Days Tuesday will be held from 17 to 19 September and is one of the largest exhibitions of agricultural machinery and associated products in rural Australia. The event attracts in excess of 800 exhibitors and more than 60,000 people during the three-day event.

Access to the event is via a single road (Henty-Cookardinia Road).

Traffic controllers will be on-site to direct motorists.

Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on the Olympic Hwy at Cookardinia Rd.

A speed reduction will be in place on the Olympic Hwy, check signage and exercise caution in the area.

Motorists are advised to allow for additional travel time.

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Carnival: Surf to Turf Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11.50am, last race at 5.15pm, concert from 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
AFC Champions League: Sydney FC v Eastern FC at Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off at 8pm, full time around 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to the stadium in the busy evening peak.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 418 and 426 bus services will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Dulwich Hill Festival on Marrickville Rd and Seaview St from 12pm to 5pm on Sunday 29 September.

Marrickville Rd will be closed between New Canterbury Rd and Durham St from 3am until 9pm. Seaview St will also be closed (managed access for residents only will be maintained via Herbert St).

Traffic will be detoured via Wardell Rd and Frazer St or Beach Rd. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on New Canterbury Rd in both directions approaching Dulwich Hill and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

NRLW: Sharks v Wests Tigers at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 7.45pm, full time approx 9.45pm.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the match in the busy evening peak. Allow extra travel time on Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick-off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

NRLW double header at CommBank Stadium. Raiders v Titans at 1.30pm, Eels v Roosters at 3.15pm, finsh around 4.50pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney, Sydney Streets event at Haymarket Saturday 21 September. The event runs from 11am to 10pm.

Sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Kimber Ln, Little Hay St, Sussex St, Factory St and Little Pier St will be closed from 8am to 11:30pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 11:30pm on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St and Sussex St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Carr website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator

properties.publicTransport: Route 311 buses will be diverting around the closures and missing some stops. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Darlinghurst Rd. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

Road closures from 8am to 11:30pm:

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Roslyn St and Macleay St
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Greenknowe Ave.
  • Sections of Orwell St and Hughes St are also closed.
  • Motorists are being detoured via Greenknowe Ave and Macleay St and via Darlinghurst Rd and Roslyn St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Elizabeth Bay Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and other local roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Macleay St between Greenknowe Ave and Darlinghurst Rd

properties.otherAdvice:
Netball Test Series: Australia Diamonds v England Roses at Qudos Bank Arena. Starts at 4pm, full time around 5.35pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the match while other events also take place in the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive should pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Avoid the traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
Multiple events are taking place within Sydney Olympic Park on Saturday 21 September, including a concert at Qudos Bank Arena:

  • AAGPS Championships at the Athletics Centre from 6.30am to 4.30pm.
  • Australian Dance Festival at Quay Centre from 8am to 11pm.
  • Parkway Drive at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts 5:30pm, finish around 10.40pm.

With a combined crowd of up to 100,000 expected in the precinct across the day, significant traffic delays are expected in the area. Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: parking in the precinct is in high demand and expected to sell out before the event. Ticketholders who have to drive must pre-book parking ahead of time to secure a space.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park. You'll need to use an Opal card or contactless payment card/device when travelling on public transport.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

Oz Comic-Con at Sydney Showground in Sydney Olympic Park on Saturday and Sunday from 9am to 5pm daily.

Sydney Olympic Park will be very busy on Saturday with a combined crowd of up to 100,000 expected in the precinct across the day as other events take place at neighbouring venues. Significant traffic delays are expected so motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: parking in the precinct is in high demand and expected to sell out before the event. Ticketholders who have to drive must pre-book parking ahead of time to secure a space.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park. You'll need to use an Opal card or contactless payment card/device when travelling on public transport.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice: The Aboriginal Rugby League Knockout Carnival will be held Friday 20 to Sunday 22 September at Oakes Oval in Lismore. Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists, as event goers make their way to and from the event.
properties.diversions: A detour will be in place via Diadem Street and Uralba Street.

properties.otherAdvice: The Living Smart Festival will be held on Saturday 21 September from 9am to 3pm. There will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL NRL Finals Week 2: Roosters v Sea Eagles. Kick-off at 7.50pm, full time around 9.40pm.

Traffic will be heavy in the area as fans travel to and from the match. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area. 
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Rd.  EP3 car park open from 4.50pm. EP2 will not be open for this match.
  • To support the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Road onto Moore Park Road westbound. Motorists can use Cook Road for access onto Moore Park Road instead. 

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland St, and from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion St Fitzroy St and Moore Park Rd. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator

NRL & NRLW Grand Final at Accor Stadium on Sunday 6 October. Gates open at 1pm. NRLW Grand Final kick-off 1:20pm, NRL Grand Final kick-off 7:30pm, full-time approx. 9:15pm.

With around 80,000 people expected to attend the NRL & NRLW Grand Final, significant delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct.  

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: parking in the precinct is in high demand and expected to sell out before the event. Ticketholders who have to drive must pre-book parking ahead of time to secure a space.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 65,000 footy fans expected in the precinct on Friday night for the AFL and the NRL:

  • AFL Preliminary Final: Sydney Swans v Port Adelaide at the SCG. First bounce at 7.40pm, full time around 10pm.
  • NRL Finals Week 2: Cronulla Sharks v Nth Queensland Cowboys at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 7.50pm, full time around 9.40pm

Traffic will be very heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to the precinct in the already busy evening peak. Other events are also taking place nearby.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the games as delays are expected.

Ticketholders should carpool with their group, plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 4.45pm and will reopen after the games. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Carparks will open at 4.45pm
  • To support the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Road onto Moore Park Road westbound. Motorists can use Cook Road for access onto Moore Park Road instead. 

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland St and Fitzroy St, from 3pm to 8pm on a section of Chalmers Strreet, and from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion St and Moore Park Rd. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator
